alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 2:03PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River BELOW below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Bear River...including below Pixley Dam...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Bear River BELOW below Pixley Dam. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Bankfull stage. At 8.5 feet, Flood stage. Minor agricultural flooding especially along left bank. At 9.5 feet, Agricultural flooding increases and becomes more widespread along both banks. Standing water on road to gagehouse. At 10.5 feet, Major widespread agricultural flooding. Road to gagehouse is under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Saturday, May 20 the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above action stage through at least the weekend. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
